q: Google has shocked it's shareholders by announcing that Eric Schmidt , it's current CEO will step down in April and co-founder Larry Page replace him in the Chief Executive Officer role. When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined, even in my wildest dreams, that we would get as far, as fast as we have today, starts Eric Schmidt in a blog post on the company's blog while meanwhile posting on Twitter that the move was all about no longer needing to supervise founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin : ''Day-to-day adult supervision

executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role-- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. ''It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

interview, Simon Cowell talked about The X Factor launch in America. With auditions set to begin on March 27th in Los Angeles, people can register online now by going to Fox.com/ thexfactor. We actually do the auditions in arenas where you have to perform in front of 4,000-5,000 people. It's a long day. You'll begin to understand why I become very grumpy, Simon Cowell told Nancy O'Dell during the ET interview that aired tonight on ABC. The X Factor auditions are open to vocal groups and solo singers, over the age of 12- and there's no upper age limit.

Poland than in Italy His comments on Friday in San Francisco were quoted by Italy's Corriere della Sera, prompting the mayor of Turin, Fiat's birthplace, to demand ''immediate clarification.'' It's clear that an international group can have several offices but it would be different if the headquarters were in the United States, Sergio Chiamparino said. A number of leading politicians also expressed indignation, and ANSA news agency said talks were planned next week between Sergio Marchionne and Economic Development Minister Paolo Romani .
